name: Popular Tea Cakes Workshop
description: Popular Tea Cakes Workshops We cover a variety of  of 5 various tea cakes that we teach from scratch. We use only the best of ingredients and source everything locally. We teach you how to bake cakes and the frostings that go with it, in a tradiotional method. Its a hands on experince and we provide the students with hand outs which they will be taking home with them.-Banana Cake with Dark Chocolate Chips-Sticky Toffee Date Cake with Salted Caramel Sauce -Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting -Orange Pound Cake Looking forward to baking the world a better place!

name: Rooting For Tubers Festival
description: Get ready, Bangalore! Rooting for Tubers is back and better than ever. This year’s festival brings you an exciting mix of food, culture, and nature, all wrapped up in the humble yet powerful tuber. It’s a fun, family-friendly day out, co-curated by Spudnik Farms and culinary creatives, to celebrate the vibrant world of tubers. Come with your friends, family, or even solo, and immerse yourself in a one-of-a-kind experience exploring flavours, traditions, and sustainability!FESTIVAL ITINERARY10:00 - InaugurationWelcome to the Tuber Festival by Spudnik Farms10:15 - 11:15 - Songs from the Soil: Tuber Tales and Cultural TraditionsA performance by the Solega Community from the BR Hills facilitated by Samira Agnihotri11:30 - 12:30 - Roots of Tradition"Tubers, Culture, and Climate" by Anumitra Ghosh & Reshma12:45 - 1:45  - Nutrition Unpeeled"The Power of Tubers" by Gauravi Ashok2:00 - 3:00 - Tuber Myths and LegendsWorkshop by Dipali Khandelwal from The Kindness Meal3:15 - 4:15 - Fermenting RootsA hands-on tuber workshop with Kobo FermentaryALL DAY EVENTS10:30 - 4:30 - Tuber MelaExplore a vibrant market of diverse tubers, fresh produce, and unique flavours, connecting you to the earth and farmer communities from across India.10:30 - 4:30 - ALT Carb 2050An interactive installation that envisions a future where carbs and carbon emissions intertwine, inviting you to rethink your carb choices and their impact on body and planet.11:00 - 4:00 - RFT Game: Join the Tuber ChallengeAttendees will split into teams, each tied to a suit of cards. Teams compete through mini-games every half hour, with rankings at each round. Top teams collect cards, building up scores for a final tally.-----------------------------------------------------------------------JOIN US IN ROOTING FOR TUBERS!15+ Community & Market StallsExplore diverse stalls featuring local farmers, producers, and communities, all sharing unique tuber varieties and other farm-fresh produce. Discover exciting new ways to cook with tubers, support small-scale farmers, and stock up on your favourite finds at the market. Interact and meet various tuber growing communities from across India!Culinary Stalls & Live CookingWatch chefs in action as they cook up delicious tuber-inspired dishes! Learn from the best as they explore tubers in creative and sustainable ways, showcasing the potential of these crops in modern cooking.Workshops & TalksLearn from experts in hands-on workshops, including fermentation, traditional cooking methods, and nutrition. Engage in conversations around biodiversity, sustainable food systems, and the cultural significance of tubers, while interacting with both culinary professionals and farmers.Art Installation & Tuber DisplayDelve into the artistic side of tubers through a collaborative art installation, featuring a colourful display of various indigenous tuber varieties. Discover the beauty and biodiversity of tubers while learning about the role they play in climate resilience and food security.

name: ALT EFF 2024 x Courtyard Koota
description: Since the dawn of time, storytelling in community has shaped our mindset, our outlook and ultimately, our behavior. With record heat, oscillating droughts & floods, fires, melting glaciers (and ... you know the rest) our current narrative needs some course correcting.All Living Things Environmental Film Festival (ALT EFF) is back for a 5th edition, pan-India cultural event. Join us at Courtyard Koota for a unique evening of cinema, art & community. Watch award-winning global films on regeneration, activism, resilience and hope and engage in conversations with India’s most inspiring change-makers. Let’s restore the narrative of stewardship, together. All are welcome!PROGRAM:27th November, Wednesday6:30 - 8:15 PM : The Giants (Laurence Billiet, Rachael Antony | Australia | 1 hr 30 mins | English | 2023) INDIA PREMIERE8:15 - 8:45 PM: Q & A with A Flaming Forest and Discussion29th November, Friday6:30 - 7:00 PM : Tomorrow, the Burning Heavens (Max Bloching | Germany | 22 mins 06 secs | German | 2024) INDIA PREMIERE7:00 - 8:00 PM : Miles Away (Megha Acharya | India | 50 mins | Bundeli, Hindi | 2023)8:00 - 8:45 PM : ALT EFF Voices (With prompts and select curation provided by us, this is an open-mic for audiences to)NON-FILM PROGRAM DETAILS :ALT EFF Voices:ALT EFF Voices is a dynamic spoken-word platform that will be a key feature of our annual festival, providing a space for individuals to share their personal stories, thoughts, and observations on the pressing environmental challenges we face today. With ALT EFF Voices' inaugural edition during ALT EFF 2024, we hope people of all ages and backgrounds will feel free to channel their grief, anger, hope, and passion into powerful yet creative messages about our environment.

location.address: Ground Floor, Tarana, Good Earth Malhar Kambipura, Footprints, GOOD EARTH MALHAR RESONANCE, Hobli, near Gate 3, Kengeri, Bengaluru, Kambipura, Karnataka 560074, India

With ALT EFF Voices' inaugural edition during ALT EFF 2024, we hope people of all ages and backgrounds will feel free to channel their grief, anger, hope, and passion into powerful yet creative messages about our environment.Fungal Entanglements: A Sensory Journey by Fungi Foundation‘Fungal Entanglements: A Sensory Journey’ is an immersive workshop that bridges art, science, and traditional ecological knowledge to explore the fascinating world of fungi. This multisensory experience, facilitated by Malavika Bhatia and Prithvi Kini of Fungi Foundation, is designed to engage participants with the often-overlooked realm of fungi, emphasising their ecological roles and relationships with other organisms, including humans.The workshop takes participants on a unique fungal adventure, engaging all five senses to foster a deeper understanding and appreciation of fungi. By intertwining scientific knowledge with sensory experiences and creative expression, the workshop aims to transform participants' perceptions of fungi from potential disgust to wonder and curiosity.Through a series of interactive stations, participants will explore fungal diversity, examine specimens under microscopes, experience various fungal scents and textures, taste edible mushrooms, and even listen to mushroom-generated music. The workshop culminates in an embodied activity where participants creatively express fungal relationships, fostering a personal connection to these remarkable organisms.Speaker’s Bio:Prithvi Kini is an entrepreneur, yoga practitioner, citizen scientist, and mental health advocate with a deep interest in the therapeutic benefits of mushrooms. As the co-founder of Nuvedo, India's pioneering functional mushroom start-up, her vision is for people to reclaim control of their lives through mushrooms. Through Nuvedo, she forges connections with local farming communities and myriad mycophiles across India and is fostering a mushroom revolution that goes beyond the world of business. With Fungi Foundation India, she's on a mission to revolutionize India's allyship with fungi, not just on a plate but in policy as well. With a commitment to conservation, her interests focus on ethical biodiversity research and Indian ethnomycological exploration. Her vision is to create a kinder, authentic and more accepting India through the power of fungi and applying to rekindle a ‘more-than-human’ outlook on our ways of life.Malavika Bhatia is a forager, artist, and community facilitator who weaves together ethnomycological research, community-based practices, and theoretical frameworks to reimagine relationships in the more-than-human world. Their art practice inhabits spaces of decay and decomposition, viewing these processes not as endpoints but as vital sites of regeneration and possibility. Through programs with Science Gallery Bengaluru, Kiran Nadar Museum of Art, Sandbox Collective, Serendipity Arts Festival, and others, they create participatory experiences that invite audiences to consider how fungal networks can serve as both metaphor and method for reimagining community relationships and ecological entanglements.Community Campaigning: Success Stories and A Pathway to Change	The session will be a deep-dive into the importance of engaging with communities for grassroots advocacy initiatives and impactful public mobilization through digital media. Jhatkaa.org will reflect on learnings from its successful campaigns that have harnessed the power of community support to create impact on a range of issues including environmental issues, social justice, and better urban planning. Additionally, successful local campaign case studies will also be sharedSpeaker’s Bio: Divya is the Executive Director of Jhatkaa.org, where she leads efforts to build an equitable, inclusive, and sustainable India. With a Master's degree in Public Health and Human Rights, Divya has over 12 years of experience working at the intersection of grassroots activism and digital advocacy, addressing critical issues in climate change, public health, and social justice.At Jhatkaa.org, she works with a team of campaigners and technologists to design and execute campaigns on a range of issues, including climate change, gender and sexuality, women's rights, and social justice. Jhatkaa.org leverages innovative technology and public mobilization to foster a movement of engaged and progressive Indians, empowering individuals to take collective action for systemic change.Divya also serves as an advisor and mentor to a regenerative communications agency, a trans rights organization, and other individual changemakers in India.Mongabay discussion moderated by ALT EFF rep Wild Frequencies at ALT EFFScience, Sound, and Story Walk into a PodcastJoin Abhijit Shylanath as he presents his experience working as a sound designer for Mongabay India’s Wild Frequencies. In this session, Abhijit will reveal the art and science behind using sound as the focal point to drive stories, creating impactful narratives without visuals. He will discuss the sound design process, editing techniques, and the essential role of editorial support in crafting powerful audio narratives. Abhijit brings unique insights on how to balance artistic storytelling with journalistic integrity, offering valuable lessons in creating compelling soundscapes that resonate with listeners.Speaker’s BioAbhijit Shylanath is a self-taught musician, producer, and audio editor. He has been making original music since age five and has a broad sonic palette from folk to indie rock to cinematic scores. Qualified as a computer engineer, he chose to work instead as a studio producer. He has 20+ years of experience making music for movies, corporate identities, events, video games, and ad campaigns. He is particularly interested in podcasts as a medium of communicating ideas and data, and believes that they have, like music, a deceptively long history of oral tradition behind them.Crisis of Consumption: India’s Overwhelming Waste Problem and What We Can Do About It What do fast fashion and animal agriculture have in common? This talk dives into the hidden impacts of our everyday choices and their toll on the environment. From the dyes in our clothing to the materials we often overlook, consumption patterns are driving a crisis. Color Ashram Foundation brings awareness to the toxic dyes used in the fashion industry and the massive waste created as a result. Consumers for Sustainability highlights the environmental costs of animal-derived materials like wool, leather, and silk—showing how these products consume water, pollute air and soil, and deplete precious land resources. Join us to discover the real costs behind these industries and explore pathways toward more sustainable choices.Speaker’s Bio:Seemanthini C. is the Project Coordinator at Consumers for Sustainability, an initiative dedicated to promoting consumer protection and fostering sustainable practices across sectors. With a background in biotechnology and a wealth of experience in organising educational camps and outreach programs, she is a strong advocate for capacity and community building. She believes these are essential tools for creating a ripple effect that strengthens the sustainability movement and inspires meaningful change.Moving Into A Climate Solutions Economy: Climate Futures and the role of Forests by Land Conflict WatchIndia has announced that it would create an additional carbon sink of 3.0 billion tonnes by increasing forest cover by 2030. To achieve this, the country has put in place a dedicated policy to carry out afforestation to compensate for the forests it loses to industries and other project developers. However, how well has this panned out on the ground? Forest communities, who had to give up forest lands that they were dependent on to industries years ago, are now being displaced again as the state is struggling for land to meet its afforestation target. Has the role of forests been reduced to only carbon sequestration?  Speaker’s BioKumar Sambhav Shrivastava Founder & Director, Land Conflict WatchKumar Sambhav is a social entrepreneur and award-winning journalist, leading innovative research in accountability investigations. He is the founder of Land Conflict Watch and is currently working as India Research Lead with Princeton University’s Digital Witness Lab. Kumar co-founded The Reporters’ Collective, a non-profit journalism collaborative in India and was an inaugural Artificial Intelligence Accountability Fellow with the Pulitzer Center. Kumar has reported for prime global and Indian news outlets, including Al Jazeera, Huffington Post, Business Standard, Hindustan Times, Down To Earth and The Times of India. He has received the prestigious Red Ink Award, the Press Council of India’s National Award for Excellence in Journalism and the Shriram Award for Excellence in Financial Journalism. Mrinali Advisor & Climate Research Lead, Land Conflict WatchMrinali K works as Advisor & Climate Research Lead, Land Conflict Watch. Her research focuses on issues of climate change and resource conflicts. For more than 6 years now, she has studied issues around land and resource conflicts, working with journalists and researchers to conduct research around the land conflict database. She has also tracked and reported on international climate change negotiations since 2022.

With a Master's degree in Public Health and Human Rights, Divya has over 12 years of experience working at the intersection of grassroots activism and digital advocacy, addressing critical issues in climate change, public health, and social justice.At Jhatkaa.org, she works with a team of campaigners and technologists to design and execute campaigns on a range of issues, including climate change, gender and sexuality, women's rights, and social justice. Jhatkaa.org leverages innovative technology and public mobilization to foster a movement of engaged and progressive Indians, empowering individuals to take collective action for systemic change.Divya also serves as an advisor and mentor to a regenerative communications agency, a trans rights organization, and other individual changemakers in India.Mongabay discussion moderated by ALT EFF rep Wild Frequencies at ALT EFFScience, Sound, and Story Walk into a PodcastJoin Abhijit Shylanath as he presents his experience working as a sound designer for Mongabay India’s Wild Frequencies. In this session, Abhijit will reveal the art and science behind using sound as the focal point to drive stories, creating impactful narratives without visuals. He will discuss the sound design process, editing techniques, and the essential role of editorial support in crafting powerful audio narratives. Abhijit brings unique insights on how to balance artistic storytelling with journalistic integrity, offering valuable lessons in creating compelling soundscapes that resonate with listeners.Speaker’s BioAbhijit Shylanath is a self-taught musician, producer, and audio editor. He has been making original music since age five and has a broad sonic palette from folk to indie rock to cinematic scores. Qualified as a computer engineer, he chose to work instead as a studio producer. He has 20+ years of experience making music for movies, corporate identities, events, video games, and ad campaigns. He is particularly interested in podcasts as a medium of communicating ideas and data, and believes that they have, like music, a deceptively long history of oral tradition behind them.Crisis of Consumption: India’s Overwhelming Waste Problem and What We Can Do About It What do fast fashion and animal agriculture have in common? This talk dives into the hidden impacts of our everyday choices and their toll on the environment. From the dyes in our clothing to the materials we often overlook, consumption patterns are driving a crisis. Color Ashram Foundation brings awareness to the toxic dyes used in the fashion industry and the massive waste created as a result. Consumers for Sustainability highlights the environmental costs of animal-derived materials like wool, leather, and silk—showing how these products consume water, pollute air and soil, and deplete precious land resources. Join us to discover the real costs behind these industries and explore pathways toward more sustainable choices.Speaker’s Bio:Seemanthini C. is the Project Coordinator at Consumers for Sustainability, an initiative dedicated to promoting consumer protection and fostering sustainable practices across sectors. With a background in biotechnology and a wealth of experience in organising educational camps and outreach programs, she is a strong advocate for capacity and community building. She believes these are essential tools for creating a ripple effect that strengthens the sustainability movement and inspires meaningful change.Moving Into A Climate Solutions Economy: Climate Futures and the role of Forests by Land Conflict WatchIndia has announced that it would create an additional carbon sink of 3.0 billion tonnes by increasing forest cover by 2030. To achieve this, the country has put in place a dedicated policy to carry out afforestation to compensate for the forests it loses to industries and other project developers. However, how well has this panned out on the ground? Forest communities, who had to give up forest lands that they were dependent on to industries years ago, are now being displaced again as the state is struggling for land to meet its afforestation target. Has the role of forests been reduced to only carbon sequestration?  Speaker’s BioKumar Sambhav Shrivastava Founder & Director, Land Conflict WatchKumar Sambhav is a social entrepreneur and award-winning journalist, leading innovative research in accountability investigations. He is the founder of Land Conflict Watch and is currently working as India Research Lead with Princeton University’s Digital Witness Lab. Kumar co-founded The Reporters’ Collective, a non-profit journalism collaborative in India and was an inaugural Artificial Intelligence Accountability Fellow with the Pulitzer Center. Kumar has reported for prime global and Indian news outlets, including Al Jazeera, Huffington Post, Business Standard, Hindustan Times, Down To Earth and The Times of India. He has received the prestigious Red Ink Award, the Press Council of India’s National Award for Excellence in Journalism and the Shriram Award for Excellence in Financial Journalism. Mrinali Advisor & Climate Research Lead, Land Conflict WatchMrinali K works as Advisor & Climate Research Lead, Land Conflict Watch. Her research focuses on issues of climate change and resource conflicts. For more than 6 years now, she has studied issues around land and resource conflicts, working with journalists and researchers to conduct research around the land conflict database. She has also tracked and reported on international climate change negotiations since 2022.

name: ALT EFF 2024 x MEDAI : The Stage
description: Since the dawn of time, storytelling in community has shaped our mindset, our outlook and ultimately, our behaviour. With record heat, oscillating droughts & floods, fires, melting glaciers (and ... you know the rest) our current narrative needs some course correcting.All Living Things Environmental Film Festival (ALT EFF) is back for a 5th edition, pan-India cultural event. Join us at MEDAI for a unique evening of cinema, art & community. Watch award-winning global films on regeneration, activism, resilience and hope and engage in conversations with India’s most inspiring change-makers. Let’s restore the narrative of stewardship, together. All are welcome!PROGRAM:4th December, Wednesday 2:00 - 2:45 PM : Stubble - The Farmer's Bane (Shaz Syed | India | 35 mins | English, Punjabi, Hindi | 2024) INDIA PREMIERE2:45 - 3:15 PM : Burnt Country (Kirsten Slemint | Australia | 17 mins 45 secs | English | 2024) INDIA PREMIERE3:15 - 4:00 PM : Very special panel discussion on Indigenous care of country. With ALT EFF Voices' inaugural edition during ALT EFF 2024, we hope people of all ages and backgrounds will feel free to channel their grief, anger, hope, and passion into powerful yet creative messages about our environment.Fungal Entanglements: A Sensory Journey by Fungi Foundation‘Fungal Entanglements: A Sensory Journey’ is an immersive workshop that bridges art, science, and traditional ecological knowledge to explore the fascinating world of fungi. This multisensory experience, facilitated by Malavika Bhatia and Prithvi Kini of Fungi Foundation, is designed to engage participants with the often-overlooked realm of fungi, emphasising their ecological roles and relationships with other organisms, including humans.The workshop takes participants on a unique fungal adventure, engaging all five senses to foster a deeper understanding and appreciation of fungi. By intertwining scientific knowledge with sensory experiences and creative expression, the workshop aims to transform participants' perceptions of fungi from potential disgust to wonder and curiosity.Through a series of interactive stations, participants will explore fungal diversity, examine specimens under microscopes, experience various fungal scents and textures, taste edible mushrooms, and even listen to mushroom-generated music. The workshop culminates in an embodied activity where participants creatively express fungal relationships, fostering a personal connection to these remarkable organisms.Speaker’s Bio:Prithvi Kini is an entrepreneur, yoga practitioner, citizen scientist, and mental health advocate with a deep interest in the therapeutic benefits of mushrooms. As the co-founder of Nuvedo, India's pioneering functional mushroom start-up, her vision is for people to reclaim control of their lives through mushrooms. Through Nuvedo, she forges connections with local farming communities and myriad mycophiles across India and is fostering a mushroom revolution that goes beyond the world of business. With Fungi Foundation India, she's on a mission to revolutionize India's allyship with fungi, not just on a plate but in policy as well. With a commitment to conservation, her interests focus on ethical biodiversity research and Indian ethnomycological exploration. Her vision is to create a kinder, authentic and more accepting India through the power of fungi and applying to rekindle a ‘more-than-human’ outlook on our ways of life.Malavika Bhatia is a forager, artist, and community facilitator who weaves together ethnomycological research, community-based practices, and theoretical frameworks to reimagine relationships in the more-than-human world. Their art practice inhabits spaces of decay and decomposition, viewing these processes not as endpoints but as vital sites of regeneration and possibility. Through programs with Science Gallery Bengaluru, Kiran Nadar Museum of Art, Sandbox Collective, Serendipity Arts Festival, and others, they create participatory experiences that invite audiences to consider how fungal networks can serve as both metaphor and method for reimagining community relationships and ecological entanglements.Community Campaigning: Success Stories and A Pathway to Change	The session will be a deep-dive into the importance of engaging with communities for grassroots advocacy initiatives and impactful public mobilization through digital media. name: In the footsteps of the Tiger of Mysore.
description: Discover the history of Bangalore fort, its tales of glory & treachery over the past five centuries with us.The walk begins with a vegetarian breakfast. After that we take our guests to explore the remnants of Tipu's summer palace, the Bangalore fort & the armory.During the course of the walk learn how Anglo-French wars in Europe & North America had their impact in Southern India too.The guests get to learn more about Tipu's weapons on mass destruction of the 18th century & how they influenced the US national anthem & how one small Southern Indian kingdom was a thorn in the East India Company's rule.

name: Malleswara Darshan heritage walk.
description: This is our walk in one of the oldest suburbs of the "old Bangalore". Join us on a 'darshan' of the many temples and other religious institutes that dot this area as we narrate to you its origins and about the celebrities/personalities who called it their 'home'. Also on this walk learn more about the Maratha connection to this neighborhood as well as how a philanthropist not only helped renovate the Kadu Malleswara temple but also helped create an entire lake in the days gone by.See how Kadu Malleswara turned into a "Mall-e-swarm" and is fast losing not only it's heritage structures but also its local culture. In between all the bytes of history we take bites from an iconic eatery in the this area.So join us on this walk next and get to know Malleswaram in a completely new light.

name: Self-defence Workshop by F.L.A.G (Fight Like a Girl)
description: We’re excited to announce an empowering event tailored for women of all backgrounds: F.L.A.G. - Fight Like A Girl. Join us this weekend for an inspiring self-defense workshop that strengthens not just the body, but also the mind and spirit.In this two-hour session, we’ll explore physical techniques, mental resilience, and emotional strength, led by dedicated professionals who are here to support and uplift. Here’s what to expect:Strength Mapper – Get your heart pumping with cardio, agility, and reflex exercises designed to reveal your unique strengths.Self-Defense Scenarios – Practical, hands-on techniques for six common real-life situations, helping you feel prepared and empowered.Professional Guidance – A chance to train with skilled coaches and address personal safety challenges.Q&A Session – An open space to ask questions, learn from others, and build community support.Lifestyle Integration – Wrap up with practical strategies to keep these skills part of your everyday life.Join us to gain practical tools, connect with other amazing women, and walk away feeling stronger, inside and out.

description: Get Ready for the Ultimate Holiday Swap+Shop at Fashion Garage: Holiday Edition!Join us for a one-of-a-kind sustainable fashion festival, where you can refresh your wardrobe, find ‘new-to-you’ treasures, and enjoy an unforgettable day with fellow fashion enthusiasts! Plus, enjoy delicious food, refreshing drinks, and lively music 🎵 🔁 How the Swap Works: i) Declutter your wardrobe & select your gently-worn swap-worthy items.ii) Drop-off/Dunzo your bag of clothes to your preferred location by November 25th.iii) Join us at the event, collect your tokens & let the swapping begin!♻️ Sustainability in ActionExtending Lifespans: Gently worn clothes get a second life, reducing fashion waste.Carry-Forward/Donate Items: Unswapped clothes will be checked and donated. Zero-Waste Efforts: Bring reusable bags and hangers to minimize waste.Eco-Friendly Venue: Our terrace setup utilizes natural light, with minimal LED spotlighting.Through this unique experience, you can embrace sustainability and make a positive impact, all while staying effortlessly stylish! 🌱💫

name: Once upon a time in Chamarajpet.
description: This is a heritage walk to the first extension to Bengaluru city by the Maharaja of Mysore. This locality was named after a famous Wodeyor ruler & was home to many famous personalities whom we will tell you about on this walk.This area was one of the first in India to have a grid iron plan and was once lined with tree lined avenues. Probably the first layout to also have main & cross roads too. It has many famous hostels restaurants hospitalschurches temples educational institutes and old homes which we intend to tell more about to you.So if you are free this weekend join us on this walk. Also included is breakfast at a legendary outlet in this area.

name: River Realms:An Immersive VR experience@Panchavati
description: This event is a part of Bengaluru Habba, a citywide Arts and Culture fest from Nov 30 - Dec 16Bengaluru—a city of innovation, growth, and resilience, sustaining millions each day. But have you ever wondered what truly fuels this metropolis? Over 100 km away lies its lifeline: the Cauvery River, the single source capable of quenching the city’s vast thirst. Rising to an elevation of 920 meters above sea level, every drop that reaches Bengaluru is part of an awe-inspiring engineering feat, delivering life-giving water across immense distances and elevations. While this feat of human ingenuity is indeed impressive, it underscores a critical reality: the city’s reliance on a distant water source is a fragile solution, one that becomes increasingly unsustainable as demand grows.In this immersive experience on the Apple Vision Pro, transport to the heart of the Cauvery in a way like never before. With stunning 16K 180° video narration, stories of conservation and wildlife, you’ll feel the river’s currents as if you’re standing on its banks, surrounded by the beauty of lush landscapes, misty hills, and abundant wildlife. Glide along the river and experience the peaceful yet powerful journey of its waters, as they make their way to our city.Dive Deeper with AR and 3D ModelsGet up close with interactive 3D models that reveal the rich wildlife, diverse plants, and the complex infrastructure behind this remarkable journey. Watch as dams, pipelines, and pumping stations come to life, illustrating the sophisticated system that transports Cauvery’s finite waters over vast distances to sustain Bengaluru. Feel the river's flow, witness the delicate balance between nature and engineering, and understand both the marvel and the responsibility of relying on a distant water source.An Experience Like No OtherThis is more than just an experience—it’s an invitation to understand the delicate balance that keeps Bengaluru thriving. Join us at Bengaluru Hubba on the Apple Vision Pro for “Bengaluru: A City Fueled by the Cauvery” Discover the lifeblood of our city, and be part of the journey that brings water, life, and hope to millions.

Rising to an elevation of 920 meters above sea level, every drop that reaches Bengaluru is part of an awe-inspiring engineering feat, delivering life-giving water across immense distances and elevations. While this feat of human ingenuity is indeed impressive, it underscores a critical reality: the city’s reliance on a distant water source is a fragile solution, one that becomes increasingly unsustainable as demand grows.In this immersive experience on the Apple Vision Pro, transport to the heart of the Cauvery in a way like never before. With stunning 16K 180° video narration, stories of conservation and wildlife, you’ll feel the river’s currents as if you’re standing on its banks, surrounded by the beauty of lush landscapes, misty hills, and abundant wildlife. Glide along the river and experience the peaceful yet powerful journey of its waters, as they make their way to our city.Dive Deeper with AR and 3D ModelsGet up close with interactive 3D models that reveal the rich wildlife, diverse plants, and the complex infrastructure behind this remarkable journey. Watch as dams, pipelines, and pumping stations come to life, illustrating the sophisticated system that transports Cauvery’s finite waters over vast distances to sustain Bengaluru. Feel the river's flow, witness the delicate balance between nature and engineering, and understand both the marvel and the responsibility of relying on a distant water source.An Experience Like No OtherThis is more than just an experience—it’s an invitation to understand the delicate balance that keeps Bengaluru thriving. Join us at Bengaluru Hubba on the Apple Vision Pro for “Bengaluru: A City Fueled by the Cauvery” Discover the lifeblood of our city, and be part of the journey that brings water, life, and hope to millions.

name: Record Store Day' 24 | Winter Edition
description: About the EventRecord Store Day in Collaboration with On the Jungle Floor (OTJF) is a celebration of vinyl, flavor, and community from noon till sundown. Get your tickets now for exclusive vinyl deals, a day of beats that span eras! Enjoy delicious food and local art. Vinyl selectors & DJs at the yardSindhi Curry⁠FiratSandeep Raman⁠Mad NeighborAnalog Market⁠The Right FeelPagal Canvas⁠Turntable Shop⁠Isaac NicoFood23rd Street PizzaNavilunaDrinksGeist Brewing Co.Wine in ProgressThe walk-in fee at the space is ₹800 plus GST.Terms and Conditions : The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an event.Do not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.This is an unseated event. Your ticket does not guarantee a seat.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Children over 3 years of age require a ticket.No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval of theirs.

organizer.description: COURTYARD is a gathering of ideas and experiences in  the heart of Bangalore. We are an open space for curated  culinary, cultural and creative exchanges, in any form they  choose to take

name: Thanksgiving Sharing Feast
description: Join us at the Studio by Copper + Cloves for a traditional, nourishing Thanksgiving dinner, in collaboration with Origin.We'll be cooking all day to bring you a produce-centred menu inspired by classic holiday favourites: stuffed mini-butternut squash, leek & sage stuffing, roasted sweet potatoes with rosemary, pumpkin pie, and cranberries—made from wholesome, seasonal ingredients sourced from Origin.We want to celebrate the true spirit of Thanksgiving with you- full of gratitude, meaningful conversations, and a cosy candlelit atmosphere. We’ll share a gratitude game to spark new connections, surrounded by a beautifully curated tablescape featuring fall produce from Origin.To start, we will celebrate with a festive zero-proof cocktail before taking a seat at the table for a family-style evening of food and connection.About our produce partner: Origin is a fresh produce brand in Namma Bengaluru that connects you directly with local farmers, delivering the freshest fruits and vegetables to your doorstep in just 20 minutes. With over 250 varieties of produce harvested within 12 hours, Origin ensures that what you receive is as fresh as it gets—without the premium price tag. Their mission is simple: to make fresh, affordable produce the standard, not the exception, all while supporting local farmers and reducing food waste.📅 Secure your spot now—tickets are limited.

location.name: Copper + Cloves
location.address: 4th Floor, 167, 2nd Stage, 2nd Cross, Shankarnag Rd, Stage 2, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

organizer.name: Copper + Cloves
organizer.description: We are all about nourishing food and creating spaces for connection!

name: The Analog Club
description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, a new event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves.Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no-one taking selfies and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can just chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter!Meet new friends, sketch, play a board game or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones).We will not be doing social media on our phones at the event, we will only take photos with a camera.Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age! **Strictly no devices for the entire duration you are present at the event (no laptops, ipads, phones) and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag- not in your pocket and no where on a table**Tickets are for entry and high tea from our renowned deli counter.

name: The Breakfast Club
description: We’re excited to invite you to an exclusive breakfast and coffee preview of Muro Café, where Bangalore will experience the best of Asian breakfast and a celebration of Single Origin Coffees of Karnataka’s finest coffee estates. Join us on every Saturday & Sunday for our Asian breakfast menu.From 9 a.m. to 12:00 p.m., experience Muro Cafe's unique twist on breakfast; from rich Crab Omelettes and indulgent Hong Kong French Toast to creamy Basque Cheesecake & more.Celebrate food, community, and the joy of coming together. Muro: https://www.instagram.com/murocafeblr/

name: Art is Life
description: November 30 & December 1Step into a world where art shapes life, and life inspires art. Join us for a weekend that celebrates art, culture, and community.Explore the Magic of Our Shared HeritageThis celebration invites you to dive into MAP’s rich and diverse collection, filled with treasures like timeless sculptures, beautiful textiles, pop culture memorabilia, and iconic photographs. These aren’t just museum pieces — they are a part of a collective cultural heritage that we all share.Be Part of the ArtThis year’s festival is packed with exciting new exhibitions, film screenings, hands-on workshops, live performances, and so much more. It’s not just a festival — it’s an immersive cultural adventure where art, history, and creativity come together to spark inspiration. Whether you are a seasoned art lover or just curious to explore something new, there’s no better place to experience the power of art than at Namma MAP.Come join us for Art is Life — where creativity blossoms, stories unfold, and art becomes a part of you!For more details and to register for workshops please visit https://map-india.org/art-is-life-2024/Art is Life 2024 is supported by Kingfisher Ultra Soda.

location.address: 22, Kasturba Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: Museum of Art and Photography (MAP Bengaluru)
organizer.description: MAP’s mission is to harness the transformative potential of art, to enrich lives, ignite creativity, and connect people.  We make art accessible and engaging for everyone through innovative experiences, meaningful dialogue and building communities.

name: In The House with F*nkytown at Muro
description: Bangkok brings its Funk to Bangalore! FunkyTown brings its signature cocktails and Bar Food to Muro Bangalore on November 29 and 30, 2024Mark your calendars for an unforgettable night of extraordinary food and incredible cocktails! FunkyTown, Bangkok’s boundary-pushing culinary sensation, is teaming up with Muro in Bangalore for an exclusive guest shift on November 29th and 30th, 2024. Featuring:Pae Ketumarn (Group Beverage Manager - F*nkytown & Sarnies, Bangkok) Earth Piewkam (Senior Bartender - F*nkytown, Bangkok)Theo Tomasa (Group Head Chef - Sarnies, Bangkok)This two-day event promises to bring a daring, sustainable twist on Thai flavors to Bangalore.Event Details:	•	Dates: November 29th and 30th, 2024	•	Location: Muro, BangaloreWhat to Expect:The FunkyTown x Muro collaboration will feature a curated menu of innovative small bites and cocktails that explore the depth of Thai flavours with a unique “funk level” scale, guiding guests through a spectrum of boldness and intensity. Prepare to be wowed by locally rooted ingredients and creative preparations that push the boundaries of conventional taste.Menu Highlights:	Bites:	•	Scallop Crudo Tart with lemongrass and kaffir lime leaf, introducing mild funk 	•	Mutton ‘Sai Oua’ Corn Dog paired with fermented chili mayo for a spicy kick 	•	F*nky Smash Burger*, crafted with wagyu and unique condiments, promises a satisfying bite 	•	Beef Tartare Cone, featuring Thai wagyu and lumpfish caviar, raises the funk 	•	Duck & Apple Snail Tsukune with smoked egg yolk, offering a deeper funk experience	•	Signature Cocktails:	•	Thai Tea Tarik, a playful blend of V.S.O.P. cognac, brown sugar boba, and classic Thai tea flavors 	•	Mango Martini, combining lacto-fermented mango and pandan tea for a tropical twist 	•	Winter Melon Collins, an adventurous cocktail with chicken fat-washed gin 	•	Durian Colada, a bold choice with white rum, durian cream, and jasmine rice essence 	•	Disco Shots made with salted plum gin and ginger ale for a punchy finish 	•	Other Noteworthy Drinks:	•	Green Curry Cocktail, infusing familiar flavors with gin 	•	Caesar Salad as a drink – a fresh, savory surprise 	•	Som Tum Cocktail featuring dried shrimp-infused rum, perfect for daring palates 	•	Pâté Old-Fashioned crafted with duck pâté butter and bourbon for a rich, complex tasteThe FunkyTown x Muro event promises a night of unforgettable flavours, with each dish and drink telling a story of creativity, sustainability, and the boldness of Thai cuisine. Whether you’re a fan of mild flavours or ready for the ultimate funky experience, this event offers something for every adventurous palate.Limited seating available. Reserve your spot now to experience the best of FunkyTown in Bangalore!

location.address: 5, Museum Rd, next to Toscano Restaurant, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

Prepare to be wowed by locally rooted ingredients and creative preparations that push the boundaries of conventional taste.Menu Highlights:	Bites:	•	Scallop Crudo Tart with lemongrass and kaffir lime leaf, introducing mild funk 	•	Mutton ‘Sai Oua’ Corn Dog paired with fermented chili mayo for a spicy kick 	•	F*nky Smash Burger*, crafted with wagyu and unique condiments, promises a satisfying bite 	•	Beef Tartare Cone, featuring Thai wagyu and lumpfish caviar, raises the funk 	•	Duck & Apple Snail Tsukune with smoked egg yolk, offering a deeper funk experience	•	Signature Cocktails:	•	Thai Tea Tarik, a playful blend of V.S.O.P. cognac, brown sugar boba, and classic Thai tea flavors 	•	Mango Martini, combining lacto-fermented mango and pandan tea for a tropical twist 	•	Winter Melon Collins, an adventurous cocktail with chicken fat-washed gin 	•	Durian Colada, a bold choice with white rum, durian cream, and jasmine rice essence 	•	Disco Shots made with salted plum gin and ginger ale for a punchy finish 	•	Other Noteworthy Drinks:	•	Green Curry Cocktail, infusing familiar flavors with gin 	•	Caesar Salad as a drink – a fresh, savory surprise 	•	Som Tum Cocktail featuring dried shrimp-infused rum, perfect for daring palates 	•	Pâté Old-Fashioned crafted with duck pâté butter and bourbon for a rich, complex tasteThe FunkyTown x Muro event promises a night of unforgettable flavours, with each dish and drink telling a story of creativity, sustainability, and the boldness of Thai cuisine. Whether you’re a fan of mild flavours or ready for the ultimate funky experience, this event offers something for every adventurous palate.Limited seating available. Reserve your spot now to experience the best of FunkyTown in Bangalore!

description: Dialogues Cafe brings to you a Sunday full of kavitā and shāyari!If you love writing or just listening to Hindi poetry or couplets of shāyari or lyrical ghazals — we invite you to a poetic sundowner filled with hindi writing and sher-shāyari. name: Dialogues with Books
description: Dialogues with Books Join us for our book club meetup every third Sunday of the month. Bring along your favorite book, the book you are currently reading, or any book that had an impact on you. Share your experience reading the book with fellow bibliophiles and participate in winding and fun discussions around the joy of reading. Do all this while sipping on coffee/tea or having a hot tasty snack from our cafe! Your Host - Bharat is an avid reader with a penchant for classical literature and philosophy. He also dabbles in writing with a diverse portfolio of works across tech, philosophy, magical realism and fantasy. His reading diet includes a mix of fiction and non-fiction with his favorite novels being The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Movable feast by Hemmingway and Crime and Punishment by Dostoevsky.Note: Rs.100 as cover is part of the ticket price.

name: Ek Shaam Poetry Ke Naam
description: Ek Shaam Poetry Ke Naam - A room. Some beanbags and cushions. Souls lost in Hindi poetry and Urdu verse. Open the doors, and enter the world of Bachchan, Dinkar, Akhtar, Ghalib, Sahir, and others.With Ek Shaam Poetry Ke Naam, we bring to you an evening of hour-long recital of poetry written by masters of Hindi and Urdu. Interspersed in these recitals are stories of their life, translations of their works and a discovery of the nuances in their written word. Once in a while, you might find a surprise - a little something out of the box designed for the lover of poetry.Come join us - the mehfil awaits. (Please note: This is NOT an Open Mic)—-Abhilash is an entrepreneur, a corporate educator, and a storyteller. He has spent much of his life reading, memorising and reciting poems of great Hindi/Urdu poets. For years, he has shared this love for poetry with close friends, colleagues and family.Radha is a story-teller, chemistry researcher, traveller, writer, mythology buff, mother, product builder, and bathroom singer - in no particular order. She grew up surrounded by the works of some of our best poets, with her mother reciting Bachchan and Dinkar and her father playing ghazals on the old tape recorder. What started as their separate childhood passions, now finds a collective expression in Ek Shaam Poetry Ke Naam

name: Pettah walk in Cottonpet : In search of faith.
description: In our fourth walk in the Pettah area we take the guests on a journey in search of "Faith".On this walk in the western part of Kempe Gowda's Pettah area we visit the shrine of the biggest Sufi dargah in Bangalore. We not only learn more about Sufism but learn about how this dargah has promoted communal harmony since the past two centuries and more.We then visit an ayurvedic massage center to see how bones are set right. Legend has it that at one of these centers was patronized by the Maharaja of Mysore as would the pehelwans in these areas who practiced khusti in the numerous akhadas.We also visit an old temple/s associated with a saint/s who left his/their mark on the locality. If time permits we will also visit a garadi mane & a heritage lodge close by.Last but not the least we treat our guests to a nice traditional South Indian breakfast at a heritage restaurant in the area.

name: Roots of Resilience: Discover the Art of Gardening
description: Immerse yourself in the serene beauty of nature with a hands-on gardening workshop designed to help you cultivate both thriving plants and a sense of inner calm.This 90-minute experience is perfect for anyone looking to learn the fundamentals of gardening while exploring how this mindful practice can reduce stress, enhance well-being, and nurture personal growth. From connecting with the earth to tending to your own patch of greenery, you’ll walk away with practical skills and a renewed sense of balance.🌱 What You’ll Experience:A calming, outdoor space perfect for learning and relaxation.Step-by-step guidance on gardening essentials, from planting to care.The joy of digging into the soil and reconnecting with nature’s rhythms.Insights into how gardening fosters resilience and mindfulness.Whether you're an experienced gardener or new to the practice, this workshop is tailored for all skill levels. Tools and materials are provided, and activities are adapted to ensure accessibility and comfort for everyone.What to Bring:Comfortable, outdoor-appropriate clothing.A willingness to get your hands dirty and your heart refreshed.Join us for this grounding experience, where you’ll grow more than just a garden—you’ll grow yourself.🌿 Spaces are limited—reserve your spot now!

name: Cubbon Park Walk & Journalling Workshop
description: Join artist Kavita Arvind & writer Suchi Govindarajan for a mindful and creative morning at Cubbon Park. Learn about trees on a short walk (1.5 to 2km) and begin your own nature journal filled with art and observations.This is a 3-hour curated experience, perfect for anyone who loves nature and would like to deepen their understanding of the natural world.🌿Connect to trees through stories and poems and close observation.🌿Learn to begin a nature journal, by picking up and drawing leaves, seeds and flowers.🌿No experience required! All you need is a curious mind.
